resources.string: Piazza San Marco is the principal public square of Venice. It is the only square in Venice, all other urban spaces in the city are called campi. It is one of the most beautiful squares in Italy, known for its buildings and architecture

The oldest and the most famous of the bridges spanning the Grand Canal. It connects the sestrieri of San Marco and San Polo. It has been rebuilt several times since its first construction in the 12th Century.

Very close to Piazza San Marco it connects the Prison (Piombi) and the Doge’s Palace. The bridge\'s name comes from the suggestion that prisoners would sigh at their final view of Venice before being taken to their cells.
Is one of the bridges to span the Grand Canal. The bridge connects the sestrieri of Santa Croce and Cannaregio. It is located in front of the railway Station Santa Lucia.
The Ponte dell\'Accademia is another of the bridges spanning the Grand Canal, it crosses near the southern end of the canal. It is not a stone bridge, but a wooden bridge with metal arches.
Located in the Sestriere of Cannaregio, it is adorned with spires lying at each end of the bridge from whence it takes its name.
Is one of the most important bridges in Venice. It is a three arch bridge, the biggest one at the center and two smaller by each side.
Located in the north side of the lagoon, it hangs on the back of the jewish Ghetto. From here, with sunny and clear sky you can see the Cadore mountains.
Palazzo Contarini del Bovolo is a Palazzo built in 15th Century. It is best known for its external multi-arch spiral staircase known as the Scala Contarini del Bovolo.

The Venice Carnival history and its origins is a subject that fascinates many people. The celebration of the Venetian Carnival,attracts tourists from all over the world and every year the Carnival in Venice transforms the city into a cocktail of parties and fun with its distinctive appointments. /n Edition 2018: 27 Jan. - 13 Feb

The Venice Redentore Festival is one of the most famous events of the city. The Redentore night is the most awaited moment: The fireworks show creates an atmosphere of many colours making the city even more magical. /n Redentore is celebrated every year on the third weekend of July.
Historic parade and competitive regattas to re-enact the past of Venice. /n Regata Storica takes place every year on the first Sunday in september.
La mostra del Cinema di Venezia

The Venice film festivalenjoys the distinction of the oldest film festival in the world. With its projections, celebrity guests and important awards, is one of the most important of the world. /n Mostra del cinema takes place in Venice - Lido and has variable dates between August and early September.

The Venice Biennale of Architecture is one of the most important events showing themes, works and protagonists of the contemporary architecture. /n It takes place every two years, alternating with the International Art Exhibition.

The Venice Biennale International Art Exhibition is a major event that for more than a century brings the best of the international art scene to Venice. /n It takes place every two years, alternating with the Biennale of Architecture.
Is a traditional, flat-bottomed Venetian rowing boat. It is similar to a canoe, except it is narrower. It is propelled by a gondolier, who uses a rowing.
The canals in venice are the major water traffic corridors. The most famous and Important is the Grand Canal.
Is a term use in Venice to indicate a minor waterway.
Is a term used in Venice to indicate a walkway along the bank of a canal or a rio respectively.
Is the city Square in Venice. Venice has only one Square, St. Mark’s, all the others are called campo.
The municipality is divided into 6 district areas called Sestrieri, which are: Santa Croce, Cannaregio, San Polo, San Marco, Dorsoduro, Castello.
